result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter M Valente was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1 and Concurrent with 14CT1385.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived on Count 2.

records.addlTxt: DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to co. jail.

Defendant Peter M Valente in court with attorney James J. Ermert.  Defendant Peter M Valente in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Matter is scheduled for Sentencing hearing on revocation.
Parties have received and reviewed the report and note no additions or corrections.
State is recommending a total of 1 year in the RCJ.
Defense is recommending a total of 9 months on all counts.
BTC: Deft is Sentenced to:
15CM447 -
Counts 1 & 2 -
5 mo RCJ on each count to run consec to each other;

15CM1655 -
Counts  2,3,4 -
Count 2: 8 mo RCJ to run consec to any other sentence and consec to 15CM447;
Count 3&4: 5 mo RCJ to run conc to each other, conc to count 2 and conc to 15CM447
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 10, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780).  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Peter M Valente in court with attorney Christopher James Simonds.  Defendant Peter M Valente in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Defense requests plea hearing. 
Defense requests bond be modified in cases 14CT1385 and 15CM447 to $250.00 cash. 
State remains silent. 
BTC: Bonds modifications are granted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Peter M Valente in court with attorney Christopher James Simonds.  Defendant Peter M Valente in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Def is requesting a short adjournment.
BTC: Matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Peter M Valente in court with attorney Christopher James Simonds.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft is enrolled in treatment.
Deft is unable to afford the SCRAM unit.
Def is requesting bond be modified in 14CT1385 to remove the SCRAM unit and be tested multiple times a week instead.
State objects to any bond modifcation for the conditions of bond and would move to amend bond to $2500 cash.
Deft indicates he is not in treatment but attends AA meetings.
Def would request an adjounrnment out to 45 days to get the deft enrolled in treatment.
BTC: Set 14CT1385 for jury trial. Motion to modify conditions of bond granted, modify bond to remove the SCRAM unit, deft must be tested at least 3 times per week.  Jury trial scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Peter M Valente in court with attorney Christopher James Simonds.  Tom Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Def moves to modify bond in 14CT1385 to $250 cash.
Deft is unable to post the $750 that was set.
State would object to any modification of bond.
BTC: Modify to $250 cash, all other conditions will remain as set. SCRAM fee must be paid prior to release from jail.
  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Peter M Valente in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Defendant Peter M Valente in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.
Def is moving to w/draw as counsel.
BTC: Motion to w/draw is granted, new atty to be appointed.  Status conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Peter M Valente in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Defendant Peter M Valente in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Status conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
